The discussion about microphone data started with a question about the best way to wear microphones. Professor B suggested wearing microphones over the upper lip, while Postdoc G mentioned that wearing them over the temples might be more comfortable. The conversation then shifted to the topic of downsampling, with Grad E asking about the sampling rate of the microphone data. Professor B mentioned that the data was recorded at 48 kHz, and that they were considering using a different sampling rate.

The discussion also touched on the topic of wireless microphones, with Grad E asking about the feasibility of using them. Professor B mentioned that they had tried using wireless microphones in the past, but had not had good results.

Additionally, the conversation mentioned the use of lapel microphones, with Grad E expressing concerns about the quality of the sound. Professor B reassured her that the lapel microphones were not the best choice, and that they were considering using hand-held microphones instead.

The discussion also mentioned the use of echo cancellation, with Grad J mentioning that they were reading up on the theory of echo cancellation and planning to use it to handle overlapping talk.
